alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Robertson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 3:04PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Montgomery and Robertson Counties through 345 PM CDT... At 303 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Guthrie, or 8 miles east of Clarksville, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Springfield, Clarksville, White House, Coopertown, Cross Plains, Guthrie, Orlinda, Adams and Cedar Hill. This includes the following highways... Interstate 65 between mile markers 110 and 116. Interstate 24 between mile markers 1 and 21. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for Middle Tennessee.
